newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean companies announce rights issue plans.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean companies announce rights issue plans.

text.p: Twelve South Korean listed firms have announced plans for 372 billion won worth of rights issues in June, compared with 372.3 billion won by eight firms a year ago, the Korea Listed Companies Association said on Tuesday.
It said 15 companies were planning rights issues totalling 558.4 billion won for July against 514.8 billion by 19 firms a year earlier.
The plans showed an increase from 230.7 billion won for May.
